column8:
I think that students need more training in fundamentals, like data types and data structures. Once they understand those ideas, then they will be empowered to learn *so much more* in R.

I would also like to discuss explicit specification of arguments in functions. I am discovering that students place objects inside functions and just expect magic to happen or they learn the argument order and don't ever specify them too often. I think that we should teach students to specify their arguments because: (1) it can help reveal when the operation is failing, (2) it's more human readable, and (3) it will help their future selves when they reference their code.
